raw.title: [ARFC] Renewal of Aave Guardian - 2024
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---
Title: [ARFC] Renewal of Aave Guardian - 2024 
Date: 2024-04-30
Author: Marc Zeller - ACI (Aave-chan Initiative)
---

## Summary:

The Aave Guardians are a community-elected group with soft emergency protection permission on the Aave smart contracts. Periodically, the composition of this group undergoes renewals in which members may join, stay, or leave based on community votes. This process has occurred in the past, with the last renewal taking place in 2022. At present, it's time for another round of renewals to ensure the Aave Guardians continue to embody the evolving interests and needs of the Aave community.

## Motivation

The Aave Guardians play a vital role in protecting the Aave Protocol. 

This proposal aims to start a renewal of the aave guardian, allowing for the removal of members who wish to step down & the addition of new members more reflective of the Aave DAO's current active contributors.

## Specification

This proposal introduces 2 different Guardians, with a majority of non-common members on each one, and different roles.

### Protocol emergency Guardian

This Guardian is the holder of `EMERGENCY_ADMIN` role in Aave v3, together with similar role in v2 and surrounding systems.
Given that speed is mandatory in an emergency situation, the members recommended are entities really active within the Aave DAO, for example service providers and delegates.

*Its multi-sig configuration will be a 5-of-9.*

Members proposed (1 representative of each):

- Chaos Labs (risk service provider).
- Llamarisk (risk service provider).
- Karpatkey (finance service provider).
- Certora (security service provider).
- Tokenlogic (finance service provider).
- BGD Labs (development service provider).
- ACI (growth and business development service provider).
- Ezr3al (Aave DAO delegate).
- Stable Labs (Aave DAO delegate).

### Governance emergency Guardian

This other Guardian has an even less frequent role: cancel governance proposal whenever detected as malicious or containing mistakes (detected on the on-chain verification stage by Certora).
The rationale of being composed by different members than the Protocol emergency Guardian is that cancellation permissions whenever possible should be held by a different party than protocol-emergency ones. In addition, speed is not as critical as the Protocol emergency Guardian, given that Aave proposals happen during a period of 5 days, and problems can always be detected with enough time-margin.

*Its multi-sig configuration will be a 5-of-9.*

Members proposed (1 representative of each):

- ACI (growth and business development service provider). In both guardians for coordination/reach purposes.
- Mounir (Paraswap)
- Gavi Galloway (Standard Crypto)
- Meltem Demirors (Coinshares)
- Emilio (Avara)
- Roger (Chainlink community)
- Mariano Conti (DeFi OG)
- Marin (Lido)
- Certora (security service provider). In this governance given their role reviewing governance proposals.

---

A detailed view of permissions of the Aave Guardian on all Aave systems can be found [HERE](https://github.com/bgd-labs/aave-permissions-book).

## Next Steps

1. Solicit/gather feedback from the Aave community.
2. If community sentiment is favorable, proceed with the ARFC snapshot.
3. if the ARFC snapshot vote outcome is YAE, Escalate to AIP stage for implementation.

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard BNBx on Aave V3 BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard BNBx on Aave V3 BNB Chain  
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-03-04

---

## **Summary**

This TEMP CHECK proposes the addition of BNBx from Stader to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

BNBx is a liquid staked token of BNB from Stader. Users can freely mint BNBx in exchange for BNB deposits and earn yield from staking.

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract address: [0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275](https://bscscan.com/token/0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275)

Detailed risk parameters will be formulated and shared in the ARFC phase, after positive community feedback from this TEMP CHECK.

**Useful Links**

- Website: https://www.staderlabs.com/
- BNBx docs: https://binance.docs.staderlabs.com/

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard wbETH on Aave V3 BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard wbETH on Aave V3 BNB Chain 
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-03-05

---

## **Summary**

This TEMP CHECK proposes the addition of wbETH the Binance Liquid Staked ETH Token to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

Liquid Staked Tokens are one of the premier collateral types on Aave and drive most of the ETH borrow demand. wBETH is one of the largest Liquid Staking Tokens on the market and one of the more productive assets available on BNB Chain.  

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract: [0xa2E3356610840701BDf5611a53974510Ae27E2e1](https://bscscan.com/token/0xa2E3356610840701BDf5611a53974510Ae27E2e1)

Detailed risk parameters will be formulated and shared in the ARFC phase, after positive community feedback from this TEMP CHECK.

**Useful links:** 
- Website: https://www.binance.com/en/ethereum-staking

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Reduce Reserve Factor on wstETH
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [ARFC] Reduce Reserve Factor on wstETH 
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-06-24

---

# **Summary**
For further alignment with the upcoming Lido Alliance proposals, this proposal will reduce the reserve factor for wstETH to 5%. 

## **Motivation**

Aave and Lido have historically seen symbiotic growth, with stETH being one of the premier collaterals on Aave and leveraged staking being one of the most profitable use cases for both Aave DAO and Lido users.

As part of the recently passed [TEMP CHECK proposal](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-deploy-a-lido-aave-v3-instance/17930) to create an isolated instance for wstETH borrowers, a number of other parameter changes were proposed to align Lido and Aave. 

This proposal implements the agreed reserve factor change for wstETH to 5%.

## **Specification**

On all networks, change wstETH Reserve Factor to 5%. 

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [ARFC], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.body:
---

Title: [ARFC] Onboard BNBx to Aave V3 BNB Chain
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-05-27

---

### **Summary**
This ARFC proposes the addition of BNBx from Stader to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

BNBx is a liquid staked token of BNB from Stader. Users can freely mint BNBx in exchange for BNB deposits and earn yield from staking.

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract address: [0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275](https://bscscan.com/token/0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275)

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | No |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (BNBx) | 5,000 |
| Borrow Cap (BNBx) | 500 |
| Debt Ceiling | NA |
| LTV | 65.00% |
| LT | 70.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 7.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 15.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flahloanable  | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No |

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC has been updated.

## **Useful Links**

- Website: https://www.staderlabs.com/
- BNBx docs: https://binance.docs.staderlabs.com/
- [TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-bnbx-on-aave-v3-bnb-chain/16850)
- [TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x9510ea1d3c9fd0f1fd67b05860ca2f1dafb65b983ff1f81d962b7dea0c47b13b)

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: The proposal aims to renew the Aave Guardian members for 2024, updating both Protocol Emergency Guardians and Governance Emergency Guardians with new members reflecting current active contributors. The renewal process includes replacing some previous guardians with new nominees.
key_arguments_for: The renewal allows updating the Aave Guardian team to reflect the active contributors of the DAO, ensuring effective emergency governance.
Confirmed participation of multiple new and existing guardians demonstrates strong community and service provider support.
Similar past proposals to update governance and protocol roles passed with strong support and led to positive protocol stability.
Forum sentiment is largely neutral to positive, with official confirmations from guardians and an addendum supporting the update.
key_arguments_against: A negative sentiment comment raised concerns about funding transparency for guardian signers, suggesting caution in financial aspects.
No significant opposition in forum comments but some community members expressed neutrality, indicating limited debate.

evidence.quote: Confirmed participation by multiple guardians and the detailed ARFC Addendum outlining changes and addresses.
1 positive, 1 negative, and 18 neutral sentiments with key early comments confirming guardian participation.
Consistent lead ratio of 1.0 for YAE option across all quartiles, indicating stable and unanimous vote support.
Similar proposals for governance updates passed with positive TVL impact and no adverse price effects.

decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline stability, unanimous early vote lead, forum sentiment, and historical lessons from similar proposals.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for the YAE option with a 1.0 lead ratio in all quartiles, indicating strong early and sustained voter consensus.
- Forum discussion reveals predominantly neutral to positive sentiment, with several key guardians confirming participation and no significant opposition, supporting the renewal.
- Similar historical proposals to update governance roles have passed and resulted in positive or stable market and TVL impacts, suggesting this renewal aligns with protocol health.
- The negative forum comment about funding transparency does not outweigh the broad consensus and confirmed guardian commitments.
- Overall, the recommendation to change aligns well with community sentiment and is expected to maintain the DAO's durable benefit and governance security.
